page.title: 10FARMING IN OFFLEY
page.content: The farm land in Offley is owned by three landlords; 66% by Sir Thomas Pilkington, 25% by the Crown and 8% by Mr Parrish. The land is mostly used for arable crops - wheat, barley and rape. Hoo Farm is the largest farm, with 3,000 acres. It is the Home Farm of the Pilkington estate and is run by an estate manager and five other men. It is totally arable land except that some hay is grown to support a flock of sheep. The only farm which has a dairy herd is Glebe Farm which is worked by a tenant farmer and one farm worker. Dog Kennel Farm is worked by a tenant farmer and his son, who breed and train race-horses as well as grow arable crops. The rest of the five farms are all run by tenant farmers and their sons.
